conversation.content: When you called and said you had security footage from my neighborhood, I thought maybe it was just paranoid thinking on my part, but seeing you here with actual evidence makes this terrifyingly real.

[measured] The camera system I installed three houses down from yours caught someone photographing your home at 3 AM last Tuesday, and then again Thursday, same vehicle, license plate matches a rental. [pause] This isn't random.
[voice catching] That's the same night someone posted those photos of my car in the forum with the message about knowing where I sleep at night.
[grimly] I cross-referenced the timestamps, and yeah, the posts went up exactly forty-three minutes after they left your street, which means they're documenting everything in real-time.
I've been moderating that conspiracy theory forum for three years, and sure, I've banned hundreds of users for threats, but this one, [exhales shakily], DarkPatriot99, they're different, methodical.

The way they disabled your porch light without triggering your home security suggests technical knowledge, probably military or law enforcement training based on the approach pattern I'm seeing. [clears throat]
[trembling] Every time I ban one of their accounts, they come back angrier, posting my old addresses, my mother's maiden name, even screenshots of my college yearbook photos.

[leaning forward] Listen, I've upgraded security for judges and witnesses in protection, and what we're looking at here requires immediate action, not just digital but physical countermeasures. [determined]
[desperately] Can you help me understand what I'm actually dealing with here, because the police just keep saying to document everything but they won't do anything until something actually happens?
What you're dealing with is someone who's escalating from digital to physical stalking, and in my experience, [sighs], that acceleration timeline is usually about two weeks before attempted contact.
[barely breathing] Two weeks?
[firmly] Maybe less.

I keep thinking about that moderator in Seattle who ignored the warning signs until someone showed up at her daughter's school with printed screenshots of every post she'd ever removed. [voice breaking]
[reassuring but urgent] That's not going to happen to you because we're going to install a full perimeter system tonight, infrared, motion-activated, cloud backup, and I'm personally monitoring it.
[overwhelmed] Why would you do all that for someone you don't even know, someone who just moderates arguments about UFOs and government cover-ups all day?
[quietly intense] Because my sister was a forum admin who didn't have someone like me to help when her stalker found her, and I'm not letting that happen to anyone else.
[emotional whisper] I'm sorry about your sister, God, I'm so sorry, and I'm grateful you're here, but I'm also terrified this is already beyond what either of us can control. [shaky breath]

Control is just preparation meeting opportunity, and right now we're going to prepare for every scenario while documenting everything for law enforcement, starting with these motion sensors. [steadying]
Okay, yes, let's do this, let's make my home a fortress if we have to, because I refuse to let some keyboard warrior force me out of the community work I've spent years building.

[with grim satisfaction] That's the spirit, and trust me, once we're done, anyone approaching your property will be recorded, tracked, and reported before they even reach your fence line. [determined pause] We're going to end this.

scenario: A forum moderator meets with a security system technician who has evidence that the online harassment she's been dealing with has escalated to physical stalking of her home address.
